definitions.example: Pomegranates are as seedy as any fruit you are likely to see.
His seedy, dirt-smudged visage caused her to look at him askance.
With her aching back and pronounced limp, she was feeling particularly seedy today.

definitions.definition: Suffering the effects of a hangover.
definitions.example: After last night’s party we were all feeling pretty seedy.

definitions.definition: Having a peculiar flavour supposed to be derived from the weeds growing among the vines; said of certain kinds of French brandy.
